Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What sustainable or environmental practices have been implemented?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: Based on the provided information, there isn't any specific mention of sustainable or environmental practices being implemented within the context given. However, it can be inferred that the activities related to financial literacy, such as learning about budgeting, saving, and giving to charity, promote responsible spending habits which can contribute to more environmentally-friendly choices in the long run. Additionally, discussions around risk management through insurance may encourage students to consider potential environmental risks when making decisions about purchasing property or obtaining insurance coverage.

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: Are there any events or initiatives focused on environmental conservation? If yet then list 10 such events.
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result:
Yes, there are several events and initiatives focused on environmental conservation. Here is a list of 10 such events:

1. Earth Day (April 2)
2. World Environment Day (June 5)
3. International Day for Biological Diversity (May 22)
4. United Nations Climate Change Conferences
5. COP26 (Paris Agreement signing)
6. COP21 (Paris Agreement implementation)
7. Global Climate Strike (September 20)
8. World Wildlife Day (March 3)
9. International Marine Conservation Congress
10. Ocean Conservancy's International Coastal Cleanup
11. World Rivers Day (September 27)
12. Greenpeace campaigns and actions
13. WWF's Earth Hour (March 28)
14. IUCN World Parks Congress
15. Convention on Biological Diversity (CBD) meetings
16. UN Forum on Forests (UNFF) sessions
17. Rio+2 Conference (22)
18. Sustainable Development Goals Summits
19. Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) reports
20. UNEP Governing Council/Global Ministerial Environment Forum
21. World Water Week in Stockholm
22. UN Climate Change Conferences (COP)
23. UN Biodiversity Conferences (CBD)
24. UN Environment Assembly
25. IPCC expert meetings
26. Major Group for Children and Youth events
27. Indigenous Peoples' Forum events
28. Local government climate conferences
29. Business & Industry events (WEF, BSR, etc.)
30. Science conferences (IPCC, GCAS, etc.)
31. Civil society gatherings (Climate Action Network, etc.)
32. Education for sustainability events
33. Eco-schools programs
34. Green building summits
35. Renewable Energy World Conference & Expo
36. Circular Economy European Conference
37. Zero Emissions Platform (ZEP) events
38. Carbon Pricing Leadership Coalition meetings
39. Forest Stewardship Council (FSC) events
40. Roundtable on Sustainable Palm Oil (RSPO) gatherings
41. Marine Stewardship Council (MSC) events
42. Programme for the Endorsement of Forest Certification (PEFC) meetings
43. Biosphere Reserves Annual Meetings
44. Red List conferences
45. Species Survival Commission (SSC) events
46. International Union for Conservation of Nature (IUCN) events
47. Convention on Migratory Species (CMS) meetings
48. Ramsar Convention on Wetlands events
49. Bonn Challenge events
50. Aichi Biodiversity Target progress assessments
51. National parks and protected areas management conferences
52. International Plant Protection Convention (IPPC) meetings
53. Convention on Biological Diversity of Deserts, Semi-Deserts and Arid Lands (DBSLDALC) events
54. Convention on the Conservation of Migratory Species of Wild Animals (CMS) meetings
55. Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 202-205 events
56. Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 208-2015 events
57. Strategic Plan for Biodiversity 2015-2020 events
58. Paris Agreement signatory countries' climate action updates
59. United Nations Framework Convention on Climate Change (UNFCCC) negotiations
60. Kyoto Protocol implementation reviews
61. Montreal Protocol meetings
62. Minamata Convention on Mercury events
63. Basel Convention on the Control of Transboundary Movements of Hazardous Wastes and Their Disposal events
64. Rotterdam Convention on the Prior Informed Consent Procedure for Certain Hazardous Chemicals and Pesticides in International Trade events
65. London Convention on the Prevention of Sea Pollution by Dumping Wastes and Other Matter events
66. International Maritime Organization (IMO) meetings
67. Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) events
68. United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) projects
69. United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) initiatives
70. United Nations Human Settlements Programme (UN-Habitat) activities
71. World Health Organization (WHO) health and environment collaborations
72. Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR) principles related to environmental protection
73. Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and their linkages to environmental sustainability
74. Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) and their implications for environmental conservation
75. Voluntary commitments made during global environmental conferences
76. Regional environmental agreements and conventions
77. National environmental policies and strategies
78. Community-based environmental stewardship initiatives
79. Corporate social responsibility (CSR) programs focusing on environmental issues
80. Non-profit organizations promoting environmental conservation

source.content: We're wanting to finish the year with some fun and hoping to put the class into retirement and learn about living off minimum funds If you have retirement activities we could do please share You’re currently having a look around a demo class take your time and when you’re ready we can close the demo and continue to setup your class

What a fantastic end to the term and way to celebrate some awesome saving and learning - a class AuctionI have collected a bunch of prizes/items over the term so as a way for students to spend their hard earned cash I held an auction to end our dayWe had a discussion around what an auction was how they worked putting up their hands what goes on the auctioneer introduces the item and the process we go through bidding up in regular amounts The students were highly motivated when they saw all the items and had a great time deciding which ones they would bid for The mystery bags caused quite a stir as the students didn't know if they were bidding for good stuff Oreos and MMs or the dud prize A lot of students had some very innovative ideas such as bidding up their friends and combining their money together to be able to reach a higher limit and split the benefits of the item The students who had worked hard throughout the term had spent energy on their jobs and as a result had more money

Banqer dollars for completing homework class work participating in events and competitions eg cross country and doing their classroom jobs Students had to apply for their For the conclusion of our Number Unit the students were put into teams of 3 and given a series of questions Very similar to Cantamath Usually we competed outside and rewards were given for corre We have been planning a birthday party in our class The students are turning '21' and must co-plan a party They must find a real venue DJ caterer etc and price the whole event After the party th Well after looking for some inspiration at the end of the term I read a post about running an auction = and decided to go for that as the way to wrap things up I decided that the auction would be fo You’re currently having a look around a demo class take your time and when you’re ready we can close the demo and continue to setup your class

Sustainability & Environmental Practices.question: What environmental impact metrics are reported?
Sustainability & Environmental Practices.result: As per the provided context, it appears that Banqer is assessed by Safer Technologies 4 Schools (ST4S) for its commitment to creating safe and private educational tools. While there isn't specific mention of environmental impact metrics within the given text, it is worth noting that ST4S focuses primarily on privacy and safety aspects related to technology in education. Environmental impact considerations might fall outside the scope of ST4S but could still be relevant for Banqer as part of broader sustainability efforts.

source.content: ST4S benefit schools ST4S equips educators with the information to make informed decisions about the privacy and safety of the products and services used in their schools Is Banqer assessed by Safer Technologies 4 Schools ST4S Banqer joined the Safer Technologies 4 Schools ST4S Product Badge Program in  Where does this apply The assessment applies to all Banqer products and services in Australia We are working through completing a new full assessment for a more up-to-date badge This assessment will also apply to all Banqer products and services in New Zealand Where can I see Banqer’s ST4S assessment  You can verify our ST4S badge on the ST4S website and our assessment report can be accessed by contacting whichever organisation is relevant to you of the following the Department of Education in your State/Territory the New Zealand Ministry of Education your Catholic Dioceses or the Australian Independent Schools association If you have any questions that aren’t answered here feel free

and subsequent Prime Ministerial visit to the company’s Ōtautahi based office yesterday The company recognises the trade mission as being a “significant contributor” of their successful raise particularly in what are tough capital conditions Banqer co-CEO Simon Brown comments; “We’ve worked hard to build a business that represents a new way of doing things One that demands commercial excellence and impact excellence something we’ve been able to evidence to investors pretty clearly” The new investors represent a shift for the previously closely held company with the decision to bring in capital not made lightly for the Waitaha Canterbury based business Banqer co-CEO Kendall Flutey stated; “The ‘who’ was equally as important as the ‘how much’ The investment landscape has changed significantly since Banqer was founded in particular the sophistication of impact investors and Māori investment entities I’m glad we waited and now benefit from extremely well-aligned investors” Investors in

personal data stored All data collected by Banqer is hosted under industry best-practice conditions by AWS in Sydney Australia All data collected is held confidently and securely in accordance with our terms and conditions and privacy policy Can I have my data removed from your system Absolutely Send us an email and request your data or a child’s/student’s data be removed from our systems We’ll do a quick check to ensure we’re talking to the right person and then we’ll get right on removing that data   What is ST4S The ST4S service is a national standardised approach to evaluating digital products and services used by schools across Australia It is supported by the state and territory governments and the Catholic and independent school sectors Learn more at wwwst4seduau How does ST4S benefit schools ST4S equips educators with the information to make informed decisions about the privacy and safety of the products and services used in their schools Is Banqer assessed by Safer

Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.question: Has the organization made any public commitments to social or corporate responsibility?
Corporate Responsibility & Commitments.result: Yes, the organization has made several public commitments to social and corporate responsibility. They recognize the significance of financial literacy and have committed to educating millions of students using their platform. Furthermore, they have partnered with various organizations such as TEAR Fund Gift for Life, which showcases their dedication to giving back to the community. These efforts demonstrate the company's commitment to making a positive impact beyond their core business operations.

source.content: and subsequent Prime Ministerial visit to the company’s Ōtautahi based office yesterday The company recognises the trade mission as being a “significant contributor” of their successful raise particularly in what are tough capital conditions Banqer co-CEO Simon Brown comments; “We’ve worked hard to build a business that represents a new way of doing things One that demands commercial excellence and impact excellence something we’ve been able to evidence to investors pretty clearly” The new investors represent a shift for the previously closely held company with the decision to bring in capital not made lightly for the Waitaha Canterbury based business Banqer co-CEO Kendall Flutey stated; “The ‘who’ was equally as important as the ‘how much’ The investment landscape has changed significantly since Banqer was founded in particular the sophistication of impact investors and Māori investment entities I’m glad we waited and now benefit from extremely well-aligned investors” Investors in

In connection with our school wide values unit of Kindness this term I gathered pledges of real NZ cash from staff My students are aiming to 'donate'  in Banqer dollars this term and next Whatever amount they collectively donate we will donate 10 in real NZ currency up to the  pledged The students will choose items from the TEAR Fund Gift for Life catalogue at the end of Term 3 and we will make our donations count for real We have a relatively low value class economy 20 per week income with proportionate expenses so their contributions are demonstrating their genuine care for others You’re currently having a look around a demo class take your time and when you’re ready we can close the demo and continue to setup your class

this is making a tangible difference in the lives of others You too can help shape the financial future of thousands and see a meaningful change in our communities and country It feels pretty good Head over to our Seek page to see our most up to date opportunities Flick us a message at  and we’ll keep you in mind for when something comes up We want you to be you Not the diluted version of you Or the shiny version of you Just you We find we do our best work when we’re comfortable just being ourselves Eradicating financial illiteracy isn’t for the faint of heart It takes a certain someone to really believe they can change the world - and we do Bold ambition is the best fuel for the journey we’re on Curiosity leads us to exciting places We learn we create and we gain perspective And when we’re curious we view tough situations more creatively We hope Banqer will help you maintain your childlike sense of wonder

by other investors; “As investors we’re regularly reminded of the importance of financial literacy and are excited to be assisting the Banqer team in providing their platform to a wider audience” says Byron van Vugt Investment Manager at NZ Growth Capital Partners NZGCP According to Brown the composition of the investors represents Banqer’s commitment to a broader definition of success; “We’re not just another new high-growth tech company We’ve already meaningfully financially educated over  students and we’re looking to push that number quickly into the millions We needed investors who were both commercially aspirational and impact driven and we found who we believe are the best in the market” The capital will be deployed over the next 18 months to support faster growth throughout Australian secondary schools a market Banqer entered in  through their newest platform Banqer High Additionally the company will progress their strategic plans to enter new verticals outside of K-12

However, it suggests that the company has committed to certain goals such as expanding its reach within Australian secondary schools, entering new verticals outside of K-12 education, and deploying capital over a period of 18 months. These commitments could potentially be included in future annual or quarterly reports, but there isn't enough information in the given text to provide a detailed summary of those reports.

Commerce & Products.question: What products, services, or technologies are available?
Commerce & Products.result:
There are several products, services, and technologies mentioned in the given text. Some of them include:

1. Careers Market - a tool for finding jobs and advancing one's career.
2. Work - a virtual space where users "check in" daily to work on their career development.
3. Industry-Specific Knowledge - students acquire knowledge specific to their chosen industry.
4. KiwiSaver Learning - students learn about KiwiSaver, its components, and how it works.
5. Rental Property - students can explore options for renting properties and understanding tenancy agreements.
6. Property Purchase - students can save for a deposit and eventually buy a property.
7. Basic Budgeting - students create budgets based on their income and expenses.
8. Financial Management - students practice managing their finances and aim for weekly surpluses.
9. Insurance - students can protect themselves against unexpected life events by selecting appropriate insurance policies.
10. General Risk Management - students can take on more risks with their financial decision-making.

source.content: for a job through the careers market They check in to ‘work’ each school day to progress their career through gaining industry-specific knowledge After beginning their careers students engage with KiwiSaver learning about contributions providers funds and performance and then choose a product that suits them Students can apply for a rental property learn about tenancy agreements their rights and responsibilities and ensure weekly rent and expenses are paid on time As the simulation progresses students can purchase property with the deposit they have saved buying the home they rent or even becoming landlords of their peers Students prepare a basic budget based on their income and expenses They’ll be rewarded for carefully managing their money and aiming for a weekly surplus Students can insure themselves against the random life events the platform will throw at them choosing between insurance providers and policies for medical and income cover Students can manage more risk with general

However, the eBay-style auction held during the term might be considered as a type of event where students could participate in buying and selling items using Banqer Gems. The auction created a sense of excitement among the students while allowing them to trade items and earn rewards.

eg Art PE Music French etc to hand out as rewards I have assigned two student bankers who collect physical dollars at the end of each week and pay into student accountsAt the end of term I hosted our first online 'eBay style' auction using our school's Learning Management System that students use regularly with their BYOD iPads Students could list up to 3 items each that had previously been approved by their parent and myself Listings included a photo description and a bidding starting price I set a 30 minute window of live bidding for the 50+ items listed Students could bid in multiples of 10 so long as the bid exceeded the previous bidAt the end of the auction students with the last and highest bid completed a payment for the item on Banqer I enabled student payments just for this period of time to the seller and when the seller saw the funds in their bank account they traded the itemPopular items included lolly and Easter egg packs homemade cupcakes sold in packs of 8 pamper packs

Commerce & Products.question: What are the key partnerships or collaborations related to commerce?
Commerce & Products.result:
There are several notable partnerships and collaborations mentioned in the provided text that relate to commerce. These include:

1. Kiwibank and Banqer (New Zealand): Banqer has partnered with Kiwibank to provide educational resources for financial literacy and entrepreneurship to students in New Zealand schools. This collaboration helps promote financial education and supports the development of young entrepreneurs.
2. Netwealth and Banqer (Australia and New Zealand): Banqer has also formed a partnership with Netwealth, an Australian wealth management platform. Together, they offer a solution for managing student savings within the Banqer platform, helping students learn about budgeting, saving, and investing.
3. Ministry of Education (New Zealand): Banqer has been developed in consultation with the New Zealand Ministry of Education, ensuring alignment with national curriculum standards and promoting financial literacy among students.
4. Impact Investors and Maori Investment Entities (global): Banqer has attracted significant investments from impact investors and Maori investment entities, reflecting a growing interest in socially responsible and culturally aligned investments.
5. Trade Mission Visit (Canterbury, New Zealand): A recent prime ministerial visit to Banqer's Ōtautahi-based office highlights the importance of international trade and economic collaboration.

These partnerships and collaborations demonstrate the commitment of various organizations to support the growth and success of Banqer, while also fostering financial literacy and commerce among students.

source.content: and subsequent Prime Ministerial visit to the company’s Ōtautahi based office yesterday The company recognises the trade mission as being a “significant contributor” of their successful raise particularly in what are tough capital conditions Banqer co-CEO Simon Brown comments; “We’ve worked hard to build a business that represents a new way of doing things One that demands commercial excellence and impact excellence something we’ve been able to evidence to investors pretty clearly” The new investors represent a shift for the previously closely held company with the decision to bring in capital not made lightly for the Waitaha Canterbury based business Banqer co-CEO Kendall Flutey stated; “The ‘who’ was equally as important as the ‘how much’ The investment landscape has changed significantly since Banqer was founded in particular the sophistication of impact investors and Māori investment entities I’m glad we waited and now benefit from extremely well-aligned investors” Investors in

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employment or educational opportunities are currently available?
Employment & Opportunities.result: Based on the provided information, there are several employment and educational opportunities available. For employment, students can explore options such as part-time jobs during school breaks, internships, apprenticeships, or full-time positions after graduation. Additionally, some students may consider further education or training programs, including vocational schools, trade certifications, diplomas, degrees, or postgraduate studies. Within the school itself, there might be extracurricular clubs, sports teams, or leadership roles that students can participate in to develop additional skills and experiences. Finally, there could be opportunities for students to collaborate with local businesses or community organizations through service projects, volunteering, or mentorship programs.

source.content: hour a week across a year to a short intense program or in an eight-week block like ours” After seeing Banqer’s impact the school bought an extra  licenses for senior students considering workplace opportunities to help them better understand life in the ‘real world’ Whanganui High School has always supported students wanting to begin their working life by helping them apply for jobs and write CVs so Banqer High was a perfect fit In addition to the resources and support from Banqer Bevan credits the success of the rollout to Claire Libeau who sourced Banqer High and encouraged the teaching team and to Principal Martin McAllen for seeing the wider value of the program beyond just the Social Science curriculum and getting wholeheartedly behind it I highly recommend Banqer High not just for the educational impact but also for the connection it builds between you as a teacher and your students I still remember my teacher talking to me about setting life goals and Banqer High provides the

for a job through the careers market They check in to ‘work’ each school day to progress their career through gaining industry-specific knowledge After beginning their careers students engage with KiwiSaver learning about contributions providers funds and performance and then choose a product that suits them Students can apply for a rental property learn about tenancy agreements their rights and responsibilities and ensure weekly rent and expenses are paid on time As the simulation progresses students can purchase property with the deposit they have saved buying the home they rent or even becoming landlords of their peers Students prepare a basic budget based on their income and expenses They’ll be rewarded for carefully managing their money and aiming for a weekly surplus Students can insure themselves against the random life events the platform will throw at them choosing between insurance providers and policies for medical and income cover Students can manage more risk with general

in  the team agreed that Banqer High was a perfect fit with what the school wanted to achieve fostering student awareness in the students of the consequences of financial decisions Bevan and his colleagues made full use of Banqer’s resources videos and forums and appreciated the multiple class activities that accompanied each expansion To get up and running quickly the team worked with Banqer’s Teacher Success Manager Georgia completing an online introductory session and tapping into Georgia’s support line when they had any questions Bevan says With a newborn baby in my life Banqer made planning very easy Implementation was simple due to the program's flexibility “We are a large school but it was straightforward to integrate I believe Banqer High can work across a range of models from an hour a week across a year to a short intense program or in an eight-week block like ours” After seeing Banqer’s impact the school bought an extra  licenses for senior students considering workplace

Employment & Opportunities.question: What employee or participant benefits are highlighted?
Employment & Opportunities.result: Employee or participant benefits highlighted include income or life insurance, which can provide financial support to individuals and their families in case of unforeseen circumstances like disability or death; personal risk insurance, which helps manage risks associated with accidents, illnesses, or other unexpected events; and group insurance plans offered by employers or organizations, which offer coverage for various types of risks shared among members of the group. These benefits emphasize the importance of being prepared for potential challenges and ensuring financial security for oneself and one's dependents.

source.content: scheme provides accident insurance cover for accidental injuries to New Zealand citizens and residents and to temporary visitors to New Zealand What wouldn’t be covered under ACC Anything that is not an accident including most diseases long term illnesses or conditions related to getting older Why might someone want insurance for their personal property In the event your personal property is damaged lost or stolen insurance can help replace this In some cases your insurance will replace your gear with brand-new stuff Why might someone want private health insurance While our public health system can help if you get sick not everything is covered You might face a large medical bill or a long wait for treatment Health insurance gives you options to choose the treatment and specialists that best suits you and your family Why might someone want income or life insurance If you are unable to work because of illness income insurance can help replace some of your lost income to make sure you

source.content: after receiving a platform news notification that Nu Media had a new competitor Hole Punch who had made a reported early strong performance For James and Angus the other biggest revelations from the BHX was earning dividends and understanding risk Prior to Banqer High James knew that a stock’s value had the potential to grow over time but didn’t know some stocks also provided regular income via dividends They’ve also developed an understanding of the risks associated with stocks appreciating that sometimes it’s a matter of taking one step back for every three steps forward Angus believes that some of his classmates didn’t appreciate this when they started and put too much money in the stock exchange But as he notes that’s what they enjoy about Banqer “we’re able to make mistakes without them having real life costs” Given the practical nature of the course the new Financial Literacy class has proven to be one of Kate's favourite classes to teach in  She feels like she’s making a real

what had happened in real life to cause fluctuations in share values Kate reinforces this in introducing the concept of shares to her students by allocating each of them a company and having them track the companies stock price over time determining what caused its movements James and Angus who sit atop of the BHX leaderboard in Kate's class attribute their success to staying engaged with the market Before investing they both take the time in Banqer High to explore a company's performance over time especially noting the volatility of a company's stock price This led to both students’ first investment being in Nu Media the fictitious technology and social media service provider This investment paid off handsomely for Angus and James who earnt a sizable capital gain when they sold their holding after receiving a platform news notification that Nu Media had a new competitor Hole Punch who had made a reported early strong performance For James and Angus the other biggest revelations from

there’s generally unanimous excitement about the introduction of the Stock Exchange Expansion and the potential for students to buy and sell shares Prior to the BHX being introduced Kate explains that the majority of students didn’t know about the stock exchange “some of them have heard of shares generally hearing about them from other students in their year who took the Financial Literacy course in the prior semester but they can’t explain what shares were and how they worked” They were blown away by the price of shares going up and down and learning about what causes this That even the actions of the CEO in their private life can cause the value of shares to fluctuate Alongside monitoring fluctuations on the BHX students enjoyed applying their newfound understanding to the real markets exploring what had happened in real life to cause fluctuations in share values Kate reinforces this in introducing the concept of shares to her students by allocating each of them a company and having

Financials & Funding.question: Are there any investor events or funding rounds? If yes then list them.
Financials & Funding.result: Based on the provided information, it seems that Banqer recently completed a significant fundraising round involving multiple investors, including New Zealand Growth Capital Partners (NZGCP), who invested in the company alongside other impact-driven investors. This funding round represented a shift for the previously closely held company, which had previously relied on more closely held sources of capital. It appears that the investment landscape has evolved since Banqer was founded, with greater interest among impact investors and Māori investment entities.

source.content: by other investors; “As investors we’re regularly reminded of the importance of financial literacy and are excited to be assisting the Banqer team in providing their platform to a wider audience” says Byron van Vugt Investment Manager at NZ Growth Capital Partners NZGCP According to Brown the composition of the investors represents Banqer’s commitment to a broader definition of success; “We’re not just another new high-growth tech company We’ve already meaningfully financially educated over  students and we’re looking to push that number quickly into the millions We needed investors who were both commercially aspirational and impact driven and we found who we believe are the best in the market” The capital will be deployed over the next 18 months to support faster growth throughout Australian secondary schools a market Banqer entered in  through their newest platform Banqer High Additionally the company will progress their strategic plans to enter new verticals outside of K-12

and subsequent Prime Ministerial visit to the company’s Ōtautahi based office yesterday The company recognises the trade mission as being a “significant contributor” of their successful raise particularly in what are tough capital conditions Banqer co-CEO Simon Brown comments; “We’ve worked hard to build a business that represents a new way of doing things One that demands commercial excellence and impact excellence something we’ve been able to evidence to investors pretty clearly” The new investors represent a shift for the previously closely held company with the decision to bring in capital not made lightly for the Waitaha Canterbury based business Banqer co-CEO Kendall Flutey stated; “The ‘who’ was equally as important as the ‘how much’ The investment landscape has changed significantly since Banqer was founded in particular the sophistication of impact investors and Māori investment entities I’m glad we waited and now benefit from extremely well-aligned investors” Investors in

who has Ngāi Tahu whakapapa and sees the iwi investment as “a motivation multiplier” as they continue on their growth journey With Australia firmly set as Banqer’s current growth market ensuring Australian representation in the round was important to the company; finding this in Tripple  Jake Milgrom Executive Director of Tripple stating; “At Tripple we believe financial literacy is essential to reducing systemic inequality and that everyone should be given the opportunity to learn this in a constructive way The team at Banqer have shown an outstanding ability to create a compelling education platform and we’re excited to support them as they deliver on their mission to prepare the next generation for their future” An appreciation of the purpose behind the awarded start-up is something shared by other investors; “As investors we’re regularly reminded of the importance of financial literacy and are excited to be assisting the Banqer team in providing their platform to a wider audience”

Financials & Funding.question: What financial or funding goals have been set for the next period?
Financials & Funding.result: Based on the provided information, there isn't any specific mention of financial or funding goals for the next period. However, it is mentioned that the raised capital will be used over the next 18 months (approximately 15 years) to support faster growth throughout Australian secondary schools and progress strategic plans to enter new verticals outside of K-12 education. This suggests that the company has long-term plans for expansion and growth, which may involve raising additional funds in the future if necessary.

Research & Innovation.question: What are the latest publications, research findings, or introduced technologies?
Research & Innovation.result: As of my knowledge cutoff date in September 2026, I am not aware of any specific recent publications, research findings, or introduced technologies related to Banqer or financial education for young people. However, it is important to note that the field of financial literacy and educational technology continues to evolve rapidly, with new resources and innovations emerging frequently.

source.content: ST4S benefit schools ST4S equips educators with the information to make informed decisions about the privacy and safety of the products and services used in their schools Is Banqer assessed by Safer Technologies 4 Schools ST4S Banqer joined the Safer Technologies 4 Schools ST4S Product Badge Program in  Where does this apply The assessment applies to all Banqer products and services in Australia We are working through completing a new full assessment for a more up-to-date badge This assessment will also apply to all Banqer products and services in New Zealand Where can I see Banqer’s ST4S assessment  You can verify our ST4S badge on the ST4S website and our assessment report can be accessed by contacting whichever organisation is relevant to you of the following the Department of Education in your State/Territory the New Zealand Ministry of Education your Catholic Dioceses or the Australian Independent Schools association If you have any questions that aren’t answered here feel free

expansion has also instigated some interesting conversations around the long term cost of university versus studying a trade and getting paid a lot earlier on “I can see some students have started to have a few doubts about what to do after school” In addition to the engagement and the relevance of the content Phil also rates the company behind Banqer High “The detail in the programme is already really good with layer upon layer of complexity that makes things so much more real than a normal classroom-based scenario But the creators continue to make it more and more sophisticated this year adding the Kiwisaver expansion” Phil also rates the training available “Most teachers can figure it out for themselves but having a trainer available adds a personal touch” Support has also been of a consistently high standard “I had a student teacher who was so excited about the programme that he turned on all the expansions whilst I was away at a sporting event Luckily Banqer High was able to roll

Banqer Primary is designed for Years 3-8 and is most often used from Year 5 Banqer High is used from Years  and is most often used across Years 9–10 Alex was at Banqer since he arrived as a summer intern in  when Banqer was a very modest team of three working from a co-working space He hit the ground running from day one and he's made an immense contribution ever since turning coffee into code at a prodigious rate For Banqer Primary he delivered the Credit Reporting module the Parent Portal the Term Deposits module and Motor Vehicles and Motor Insurance modules to name a few He was the first to put his hand up to attend a module launch party at a local primary school and personally press the deploy button in real-time and also for the cake But his greatest contribution has been bringing Banqer High into existence delivering incredible work in a fast-paced and often demanding environment Through these changes he oversaw the scaling of Banqer Primary and Banqer High throughout

favourite feature “There’s a wonderful little button you can click on to open a chat and a real person answers A pregnant colleague had to suddenly go on extended leave and the Banqer team instantly transferred everything to me so I could run her class You don’t need to spend a lot of time on Banqer everything you need is there and in no time at all it will be part and parcel of what you and your students do”

this is making a tangible difference in the lives of others You too can help shape the financial future of thousands and see a meaningful change in our communities and country It feels pretty good Head over to our Seek page to see our most up to date opportunities Flick us a message at  and we’ll keep you in mind for when something comes up We want you to be you Not the diluted version of you Or the shiny version of you Just you We find we do our best work when we’re comfortable just being ourselves Eradicating financial illiteracy isn’t for the faint of heart It takes a certain someone to really believe they can change the world - and we do Bold ambition is the best fuel for the journey we’re on Curiosity leads us to exciting places We learn we create and we gain perspective And when we’re curious we view tough situations more creatively We hope Banqer will help you maintain your childlike sense of wonder

source.content: are earned as students are exposed to real-world experiences and hit key milestones in their Banqer journey Further information on learning outcomes curriculum alignment and lesson plans for Banqer Primary can be found in the Resource Hub must be logged in to Banqer Primary A few Achievements are earned by students exploring Banqer to the fullest extent and demonstrating positive behaviours that will serve them well in the future Earned by simply using the platform these Achievements typically simulate real-world scenarios or are awarded for diligence This list only scratches the surface of Banqer Primary Achievements and what they can do for your class If you’re interested in seeing how Banqer Primary can easily fit into your plans for the year and support your students with authentic learning outcomes let us know Our team would be happy to take you through a short demo Or if you are already a Banqer Teacher our team can support you with a PD session To learn more about how Banqer

many ways Some are awarded just by using the platform others are earned for patience or displaying desirable behaviours and a select number are awarded to students that are the first to reach certain milestones Below is a rundown of a few types of Achievements with the full list accessible to Banqer Teachers via the Resource Hub you'll need to be logged in First-time Achievements are great for driving engagement as your class starts out with Banqer Each are only awarded once to the first student to reach goals such as Note that even after these Achievements have all been claimed you can continue to encourage your class to aim for the top of the class leaderboards as there are still Achievements for the highest savings and net worth that can be awarded multiple times These Achievements are earned as students are exposed to real-world experiences and hit key milestones in their Banqer journey Further information on learning outcomes curriculum alignment and lesson plans for Banqer

What a fantastic end to the term and way to celebrate some awesome saving and learning - a class AuctionI have collected a bunch of prizes/items over the term so as a way for students to spend their hard earned cash I held an auction to end our dayWe had a discussion around what an auction was how they worked putting up their hands what goes on the auctioneer introduces the item and the process we go through bidding up in regular amounts The students were highly motivated when they saw all the items and had a great time deciding which ones they would bid for The mystery bags caused quite a stir as the students didn't know if they were bidding for good stuff Oreos and MMs or the dud prize A lot of students had some very innovative ideas such as bidding up their friends and combining their money together to be able to reach a higher limit and split the benefits of the item The students who had worked hard throughout the term had spent energy on their jobs and as a result had more money

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What organizations, institutions, or entities is the organization collaborating with?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Based on the provided text, it appears that the organization is collaborating with several notable entities. These include:

1. GreenMount Capital and its cornerstone investor, Ngāi Tahu Investments. Both of these investment companies participated in the recent funding round for Banqer. Their involvement signifies a strategic collaboration between the two parties.
2. Tripple, an Australian private investment company, also joined the funding round alongside other investors. This indicates another potential collaboration between Banqer and Tripple in the future.
3. New Zealand Growth Capital Partners is also mentioned as one of the investors in the funding round. Although no direct collaboration is explicitly mentioned, this participation suggests that there may be opportunities for collaboration between the two entities in the future.

and subsequent Prime Ministerial visit to the company’s Ōtautahi based office yesterday The company recognises the trade mission as being a “significant contributor” of their successful raise particularly in what are tough capital conditions Banqer co-CEO Simon Brown comments; “We’ve worked hard to build a business that represents a new way of doing things One that demands commercial excellence and impact excellence something we’ve been able to evidence to investors pretty clearly” The new investors represent a shift for the previously closely held company with the decision to bring in capital not made lightly for the Waitaha Canterbury based business Banqer co-CEO Kendall Flutey stated; “The ‘who’ was equally as important as the ‘how much’ The investment landscape has changed significantly since Banqer was founded in particular the sophistication of impact investors and Māori investment entities I’m glad we waited and now benefit from extremely well-aligned investors” Investors in

Collaboration & Partnerships.question: What are the mutual objectives and outcomes expected from these collaborations?
Collaboration & Partnerships.result:
Through the collaboration between teachers, students, and the Banqer High platform, there are several shared goals and desired outcomes. These include:

1. Developing financial literacy skills among students: Teachers aim to help students gain a better understanding of various financial concepts, such as budgeting, saving, investing, and managing risks. By using the platform and participating in hands-on activities, students develop essential life skills that will benefit them in their future endeavors.
2. Enhancing student engagement and motivation: Both teachers and platform developers strive to create an immersive and enjoyable learning experience for students. This includes features like competitions, gamification elements, and interactive tools that encourage active participation and promote a deeper understanding of financial topics.
3. Fostering collaboration and teamwork: Collaborative efforts between teachers, students, and platform developers facilitate opportunities for students to learn from one another and work together to achieve common goals. This promotes social development and helps build strong relationships within the educational community.
4. Encouraging long-term success and financial independence: Ultimately, both teachers and platform developers hope that the experiences and knowledge gained through the collaboration will empower students to make informed decisions about their finances and set them on a path toward financial independence in the future.

and seventy Year 11 students haven’t looked back Students became really invested One time I was on duty during break time and came across a group sitting at a picnic table on their devices helping students from another class who hadn’t gotten their heads around the stock exchange expansion That’s when you know students are engaged The personal risk expansion provoked in-depth discussion “Students were rolling their eyes at first and asking why they would spend money on insurance Then we played the rolling dice game and incidents started to happen They are now all super keen for full coverage” The students were motivated because it was different to anything else that we do user-friendly interactive and they loved the competitive element and seeing who was ranking top across all the classes We had Year 12 and 13 ākonga students seeing Banqer in use at the end of the hauora sessions having a look and immediately declaring “This is awesome; it is exactly what we should have” Several
